original_body_lines: Exhibitors representing construction, power and energy, solar power technologies, housing, building materials, interior décor, service providers, etc.

The three-day Construction Power & Energy Expo is Sri Lanka’s premier exhibition in the construction, interior products, power, and energy-related sectors opened yesterday at the BMICH. With its 8th successive year, the expo provides a comprehensive platform for industry stakeholders, service providers, and exhibitors to showcase their products and services, forge valuable connections, and drive industry innovation.

The highly anticipated exhibition stands out as one of the only events that brings together multiple industries under one roof, including power, energy, construction, housing, interior, building and materials. This event is organised by Lanka Exhibition & Conference Services Ltd., (LECS) – a presidential award-winning company for organizing exhibitions in Sri Lanka.

The Construction Power & Energy Expo 2023 presents unparalleled networking opportunities for industry professionals. Architects, engineers, contractors, and decision-makers from various sectors will converge at the expo, creating an ideal environment for exhibitors to forge new partnerships and expand their business networks. Unlike generic trade shows, this exhibition specifically caters to the construction, interior products, power, and energy-related sectors. It brings together multiple industries under one roof, creating a dynamic platform for networking, showcasing products, and elevating brands. Visitors will have the convenience of exploring, comparing, and finding the perfect solutions for their projects in one location. In addition to the exhibition, the expo provides visitors with the opportunity to gain valuable insights and knowledge from industry experts through a series of seminars, workshops, and panel discussions.

These sessions delve into the latest trends, practical knowledge, and invaluable insights in the power, energy, construction, and interior sectors. By learning from thought leaders, visitors can stay ahead of the curve in this ever-evolving industry.

The Construction Power & Energy Expo is more than just a display of products—it’s an immersive experience. Visitors can engage in live demonstrations, interactive displays, and hands-on activities to get a real sense of the innovative solutions showcased at the expo.
